greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: First differences of A328984.
comment: This is a simplified version of A328196.
Conjecture: satisfies a linear recurrence having signature (-1, 0, 0, 1, 1). - _Harvey P. Dale_, Apr 06 2021
formula: If n is a multiple of 4 then a(n) = 5*t+1 where t = n/4;
if n is 2 mod 4 then a(n) = 5*t+4 where t = (n-2)/4;
if n is 1 mod 4 then a(n) = -(5*t-2) where t = (n-1)/4;
if n i s 3 mod 4 then a(n) = -(5*t+2) where t = (n-3)/4.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 06 2019
